alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued December 13 at 10:48AM MST until December 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in freezing fog. Minor ice accumulation possible. * WHERE...South Laramie Range including the Interstate 80 Summit. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of very low visibility and freezing fog will result in hazardous travel conditions through Wednesday evening across southeast Wyoming. Please use extra caution over bridges. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Fog may lift briefly this afternoon, leading to a period of improved visibility. Dense fog and poor visibility is likely to return late this afternoon and continue through the evening.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads.
